detail.content: Wireless Printing at Bobst Library                                                          Home           Wireless Printing from Personal Laptops   It is possible to submit print jobs wirelessly at Bobst Library from your own laptop. Once you are connected to NYU’s wireless network, you can install software that allows you to send jobs to the library’s black & white and color printing systems.   Please go to this website for instructions and the download packages for both Mac and Windows computers:   http://www.nyu.edu/its/print/      NYU Division of Libraries

Service       Sustainability at NYU                        About     Instructions for use     General information     Troubleshooting     Benefits              About the NYU Print Service    NYU Print Service is an easy-to-use, two-step process that broadens your printing options while also conserving resources and helping the environment.    To use the service at any NYU Print Service-enabled location , you tag your document (establish ownership) and send it to your personal NYU Print Service queue using any computer connected to NYU-NET, including those at the ITS Academic Technology Centers and CoLabs in New York. Then you go to any NYU Print Station; swipe or tap your NYUCard (or, optionally, a Bobst Library Print Card if in New York); and print your document on the adjacent printer.        Instructions for use    Please consult the ServiceLink Knowledge Base for instructions on how to use the NYU Print Service:         Setting up a personal Windows computer     Setting up a personal Mac computer     Printing from a Windows computer     Printing from a Mac computer            General information     Please consult the ServiceLink Knowledge Base for additional information about the NYU Print Service:        Printing costs and payment options     Print Grant amount and eligibility     Print Station locations     Using a Bobst Library Print Card for NYU Print Service charges     Buying or addding funds to a Bobst Library Print Card     Adding funds to your Campus Cash account     Checking Print Grant, Campus Cash, and Bobst Print Card balance     Rolling over Print Grant to new or replacement NYUCard     Reducing printing charges and conserving paper     Printing double-sided and printing multiple pages per sheet             Troubleshooting    Please consult the ServiceLink Knowledge Base for troubleshooting tips:         Job not appearing in print queue     Unable to print due to 'not in system' error     NYUCard rejected at Print Service station     Document damaged during printing     Printer crashes when printing in Microsoft Word for Mac     Print Grant exhausted     Jobs do not appear on printer terminal when submitting from MS Office for Windows            Benefits    Convenience & ease-of-use . With the new NYU Print Service, you can print your documents where and when you wish to print them. No guessing — the printer is always right near the Print Station that you choose to use. Each document stays in your Print Service queue for up to 24 hours waiting for you to print it, and it won’t be printed until you’re right there, ready to pick it up.    Efficient & green . The NYU Print Service also supports the University’s efficiency and green initiatives by encouraging double-sided and more selective printing. By printing only what you need, and using some savvy printing tips , you can conserve your print grant, keep your printing costs low, and help reduce paper waste by 30 percent!       Page last reviewed: February 4, 2015

Photocopying, & Imaging in Bobst Library       Contents     Printing   Photocopying   Microform Printing   Copy Cards/Campus Cash   Imaging/Scanning           Printing   Network printing is available from every Bobst Library computer and laptop. To enable network printing from your own laptop, download this software .   Directions:     Display the article or document, select “Print,” then choose either “Bobst Printing Services” or “Bobst Color Print Services.”   When prompted, enter your NYU NetID. (Guests enter number on bottom of guest copy card .)   Go to any Bobst or ITS print station . Swipe your NYUCard and enter your NetID. (Guests swipe your guest copy card and enter number on bottom of card.)   Bobst Library print station locations:    Lower Level 2, near Copier Room   Lower Level 1, BLCC   Floors 1, 4, 5, 6, & 9, south   3rd fl., east   Color print stations: Lower Level 1 & 5th fl.     Report problems with the printers to 212-992-9020 or nearest service desk.   Printing costs 10 cents per page (75 cents per page for color).     NYU community members: Use NYUCard. Print Grant is applicable at all Bobst and ITS stations.   Guests: Purchase a copy card at a VTS .     Photocopying       Self-service photocopiers are located throughout Bobst Library. Locations:     Lower Level 1, Copier Room   Floors 1-5 & 7-9, south   Color copiers: Floors 3 & 9     Report any problems with the photocopiers to 718-237-0060, or nearest service desk, and please give the machine ID#.   Photocopies costs 10 center per page (75 cents for color), payable by Campus Cash or copy card .   Microform Printing       Printing from microformats is available in the Microform Center (Lower Level 2), payable by Campus Cash or copy card.   Some microform readers also provide scanning and digital delivery options.       Copy Cards/Campus Cash   Library users can add Campus Cash value to their NYUCard or purchase a guest copy card at Value Transfer Stations (VTS). A one-time $.80 card fee is charged for the guest copy card.   VTS locations:     Lower Level 2, Copier Room   Lower Level 1, BLCC   Floors 1 & 5, south     Report any problems with the VTS to NYUCard Services at 212-993-2273 or the nearest service desk.   Departmental copy cards are available. Contact NYUCard Services to set up your departmental account.       Imaging/Scanning   No cost scanning (8 ½ x 14 flatbed) is available at these locations:     Lower Level 2, near copier room)   Lower Level 1, BLCC   Floors 1 & 4-9, south     For larger and advanced imaging projects, use The Digital Studio (5th floor).
